ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And our earlier ancestors as well?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And so also shall our forefathers of yore be raised to life?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Will our forefathers also be brought to life again?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And also our fathers of old"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, and our fathers, the ancients?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And also our fathers of old?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And also our fathers of old?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What, and our forefathers, the ancients'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:17] And our forefathers too?’ (read aw ābā’unā indicating a supplement; or read a-wa-ābā’unā as an interrogative, effecting the supplement with the wāw; so that what is being supplemented is either the inna together with its subject [sc. a-inna la-mab‘ūthūna], or the subject [of the verb] la-mab‘ūthūna, in which case the interrogative hamza is a separator).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: They asked: (And our forefathers) shall they be raised again?
